greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T(n,m) = 2*(2m+3)!*(4n+2m+1)!/(m!*(m+2)!*n!*(3n+2m+3)!) read by antidiagonals.
comment: T(n,m) is the number of rooted nonseparable (2-connected) triangulations of the disk with n internal nodes and 3 + m nodes on the external face. The triangulation has 2*n + m + 1 triangles and 3*(n+1) + 2*m edges. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 21 2021
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
William G. Brown, Enumeration of Triangulations of the Disk, Proc. Lond. Math. Soc. s3-14 (1964) 746-768.
example: The array starts at row n=0 and column m=0 as
maple: for m from 0 to d do
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := 2*(2*m+3)!*(4*n+2*m+1)!/m!/(m+2)!/n!/(3*n+2*m+3)!; Table[T[n-m, m], {n, 0, 13}, {m, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2014, after Maple *)
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 29 2008
